newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP says 1996 dividend increase possible.
newsitem.headline: SAP says 1996 dividend increase possible.

text.p: German software developer SAP AG said on Friday it might raise its dividend for 1996 after sales and profit for the year rose more than expected.
"I can easily imagine an increase" in the 1996 dividend, SAP chief executive Dietmar Hopp said in an interview with Reuters.

A continuation of the robust growth of the fourth quarter in 1996 would be too much to hope for, however, Hopp said. But he said SAP would still grow faster than the overall market for "client/server" business software, which itself continued to grow strongly.
He also said SAP aimed to keep cost increases below sales growth in 1997.
